intro: Uapaca louvelii, commonly known as the Congo velvet bean, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces edible, bean-like fruits that are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Its bark and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, making it of interest for pharmacological research. Uapaca louvelii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
